acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=140microg/L of the crustacea (Marsupenaeus Japonicus) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 (4 hours) value of 100ppm (0.52mg/L), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 0.74mg/L (2 hours) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)), 0.78mg/L (2 hours) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)) and 0.77mg/L (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (1,320ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.133kPa (22degC) (CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 679mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 625mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998)), 1,660mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998)) and 1,231mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2001) and Category B2 by EPA (1994).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 70.9% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=2.3 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though the substance acts on many metals in the presence of water according to ICSC (2004). Classified into "Corrosive Substances" by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods. However, the category includes skin corrosivity, and it is unclear whether the substance is classified as "metal" corrosive (UN#1738).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 67degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2004), which is classified into Category 4.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in IARC 71 (1999) and NTP DB (Access on March 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 585degC (ICSC, 2004).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of body length reduction of the embryo, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005), CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998) and SIDS (2002) (no data presented on maternal toxicity).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)): "The substance is corrosive to the eye. In the form of vapour, it causes irritation of the eye, skin and respiratory tract."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on 24-hour skin irritation tests in rabbits (SIDS (2002)): "severe flare followed by swelling and necrosis." Also based on the description of the human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998)): "very strong irritation of the skin, eye and mucous membranes." The substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI Hazard Data 97-4 (1998) and SIDS (2002)): "Skin sensitization: positive."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory system),
Category 2 (heart, liver, thyroid)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, respiratory system)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (heart, liver, thyroid)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "workers occupationally exposed to the substance exhibited debility, fatigue, persistent headache and increased excitability" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)), and the evidence from animal studies including "necrosis of the cardiac muscle, severe hyperplasia, severe congestion and edema in the heart/lung/liver, a significant increase in the incidence of hyperplasia/focal necrosis of the cardiac muscle, degeneration of the thyroid gland, severe injury in the respiratory/olfactory epithelium, diffuse pulmonary edema" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (respiratory organs) and Category 2 (heart, liver, thyroid gland).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "strong irritation of the upper respiratory organs accompanied by coughing and dizziness; inhalation of high concentrations causes pulmonary edema, tetraplegia and loss of consciousness" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005)).
